net.hudup.core.client

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.client.ProtocolParam
      • net.hudup.core.client.Request
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Request
extends ProtocolParam
    Note, Request class represents user request. Request uses JSON format as exchangeable means in client-server network. Note, JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a human-read format used for interchange between many protocols, available at http://www.json.org. User request includes recommendation request, retrieval request, update request. Each request has a so-called action which is a short description (short string) of such request. Action can be considered as the purpose of request. For example, the request that user requires a list of recommended items has action "recommend_user".
    Request also contains many public variables for specifying its purpose (its result). For example, the recommendation request uses its public variable recommend_param to store parameter of recommendation. Such information contains user profile, ratings of such user on many items, list of contexts (place, time, accompany) relevant to user ratings.
    Both request (represented by Request class) and response (represented by Response class) extend directly protocol parameter specified by abstract class ProtocolParam and so they have a tight interaction. There are two types of request as follows:
    • Recommendation request is that user prefers to get favorite items. Exactly, this request wraps RecommendParam which is the first input parameter of methods Recommender.estimate(...) and Recommender.recommend(...).
    • Retrieval or update request is that user wants to retrieve or update her/his ratings and profiles.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • action

        public java.lang.String action
        Action of request. For example, the request that user requires a list of recommended items has action "recommend_user". This public variable is the most important one.

      • account_name

        public java.lang.String account_name
        Account name. Note, account is the information of a user who has access to Hudup server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile. Account is the information of a user who has access to the server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile.

      • account_password

        public java.lang.String account_password
        Password of account. Note, account is the information of a user who has access to Hudup server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile. Account is the information of a user who has access to the server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile.

      • account_privileges

        public int account_privileges
        Privileges of account. Note, account is the information of a user who has access to Hudup server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile. Account is the information of a user who has access to the server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile.

      • attribute

        public java.lang.String attribute
        Attribute name. Note, attribute represented by Attribute class indicates the data type, which is also a wrapper of data type. Each attribute has always a name.

      • condition

        public Profile condition
        Condition is the special profile which is used in condition clause where in SQL statement for processing database, for example.

      • external_itemid

        public java.io.Serializable external_itemid
        Item identifier (item ID) is stored in outside database different from the Hudup database.

      • external_record

        public ExternalRecord external_record
        External record represented by ExternalRecord class is a record (a row in table) which is stored in other database (different from the framework database). It is opposite to internal record represented by InternalRecord class which is a record stored in the framework database.

      • external_userid

        public java.io.Serializable external_userid
        User identifier (user ID) is stored in outside database different from the Hudup database.

      • file_type

        public int file_type
        File type such as Hudup file type (*.hdp), text file type (*.txt), CSV file type (*.csv), etc.

      • file_path

        public java.lang.String file_path
        File path such as C:/Hudup/datasets/movielens/rating001.test

      • internal_record

        public InternalRecord internal_record
        Internal record represented by InternalRecord class is a record (a row in table) stored in the framework database.

      • itemid

        public int itemid
        Item identifier (item ID).

      • host

        public java.lang.String host
        The host where Hudup server is deployed, for examle, "localhost".

      • max_recommend

        public int max_recommend
        Recommendation service produces a list of recommended item. This variable specifies the maximum number of recommended items.

      • nominal

        public Nominal nominal
        Nominal data indicates discrete and non-number data such as weekdays {Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday}. Nominal data is called nominal, in brief, represented by Nominal class.

      • nominal_ref_unit

        public java.lang.String nominal_ref_unit
        The unit name of nominal (s). Note, nominal data indicates discrete and non-number data such as weekdays {Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday}. Nominal data is called nominal, in brief, represented by Nominal class. Unit represents a CSV file, database table, Excel sheet, etc. Unit is used to store object such as user profile, item profile, rating matrix, etc.

      • port

        public int port
        The port where Hudup server serves incoming requests. As ususal, the port of recommendation server is 10151.

      • profile

        public Profile profile
        Specified profile. Note, Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file).

      • queryids

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> queryids
        Specified set of identifiers (IDs). Such IDs can be user IDs or item IDs.

      • rating_vector

        public RatingVector rating_vector
        Note, rating vector represented RatingVector contains ratings. If rating vector is user rating vector, it contains all ratings of the same user on many items. If rating vector is item rating vector, it contains all ratings of many users on the same item.

      • rating

        public Rating rating
        This is a rating that a user gives on an item, represented by Rating class.

      • recommend_param

        public RecommendParam recommend_param
        Specified recommendation parameter represented by RecommendParam. Recommendation parameter contains important information as follows:
        • Initial rating vector which can be user rating vector or item rating vector.
        • A profile which can be user profile containing user information (ID, name, etc.) or item profile containing item information (ID, name, price, etc.).
        • A context list relevant to how and where user (s) rates (rate) on item (s).
        • Additional information must be serializable.

      • reg_name

        public java.lang.String reg_name
        Registered name of recommendlet. Recommendlet represented by Recommendlet class is service or a small graphic user interface (GUI) that allows users to see and interact with a list of recommended items. Recommendlet is now deprecated.

      • session_attribute_name

        public java.lang.String session_attribute_name
        Specified name of the current session in server. Hudup server (recommendation server) serves all incoming request in a time interval (a period in mili-seconds). Such time interval is called session. Each session has a number of attributes. Each attribute is a pair of key and value. Key is also called name. When it is time-out which means that the server has received no request after the time interval then, the session is destroyed, which causes that all attributes are destroyed.

      • sql

        public java.lang.String sql
        Specified SQL statement. Note, SQL which is abbreviation of Structured Query Language is a formal language for accessing relation database.

      • unit

        public java.lang.String unit
        Specified unit name. Unit represents a CSV file, database table, Excel sheet, etc. Unit is used to store object such as user profile, item profile, rating matrix, etc.

      • userid

        public int userid
        User identifier (user ID).

        public Request()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • isQuitRequest

        public boolean isQuitRequest()
        Testing whether or not this request is quit request. Quit request is the one that requires server to quit, which means that server will be stopped and removed from memory.
        Returns:
        whether or not this request is quit request.

      • createQuitRequest

        public static Request createQuitRequest()
        Creating a quit request. Quit request is the one that requires server to quit, which means that server will be stopped and removed from memory.
        Returns:
        quit request that requires server to quit.

      • toJson

        public java.lang.String toJson()
        Description copied from class: ProtocolParam
        Converting this parameter into JSON format.
        Specified by:
        toJson in class ProtocolParam
        Returns:
        JSON text form of this parameter. Note, JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a human-read format used for interchange between many protocols, available at http://www.json.org.

      • parse

        public static Request parse(java.lang.String jsonText)
        Parsing (converting) the specified JSON text (text form of a request) into the request. JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a human-read format used for interchange between many protocols, available at http://www.json.org. In this framework, JSON is often used to represent a Java object as a text, which means that JSON text is converted into Java object and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        jsonText - specified JSON text (text form of a request).
        Returns:
        request from JSON text.

      • parse

        public static Request parse(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
        Parsing (converting) a set of key-value pairs. Such set is represented as a specified map. Each pair is called a parameter having a key and an associated value. Both key and value are text strings. The key is name of a public variable (public field). The value (in text string form) is parsed as real value of such variable. For example, there is an one-entry map {"queryids":"1,2,3"}. The key "queryids" is the name of variable queryids. The text value "1,2,3" is parsed as the set {1,2,3}. Finally, the variable queryids is assigned by the set {1,2,3}.
        Parameters:
        params - set of key-value pairs.
        Returns:
        request from map of parameters.
